fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2024e2.equipments.hairdryer.mil

Class HairDryerElectricityModel

  • java.lang.Object
    • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.Model
      • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.AtomicModel
        • fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
          • fr.sorbonne_u.components.hem2024e2.equipments.hairdryer.mil.HairDryerElectricityModel
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableDefinitionsAndSharingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.interfaces.VariableInitialisationI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.AtomicModelI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.EventsExchangingI, fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.models.interfaces.ModelI, java.io.Serializable

    @ModelExternalEvents(imported={SwitchOnHairDryer.class,SwitchOffHairDryer.class,SetLowHairDryer.class,SetHighHairDryer.class})
 @ModelExportedVariable(name="currentIntensity",
                       type=java.lang.Double.class)
public class HairDryerElectricityModel
extends fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.AtomicHIOA
    The class HairDryerElectricity_MILModel defines a MIL model of the electricity consumption of a hair dryer.

    Description

    The hair dryer can be switched on and off, and when switched on, it can be either in a low mode, with lower electricity consumption, or a high mode, with a higher electricity consumption.

    The electricity consumption is represented as a variable of type double that has to be exported towards the electric meter MIL model in order to be summed up to get the global electricity consumption of the house.

    To model the user actions, four events are defined to be imported and the external transitions upon the reception of these events force the hair dryer electricity model in the corresponding mode with the corresponding electricity consumption.

    • Imported events: SwitchOnHairDryer, SwitchOffHairDryer, SetLowHairDryer, SetHighHairDryer
    • Exported events: none
    • Imported variables: none
    • Exported variables: name = currentIntensity, type = Double

    Glass-box Invariants

     invariant       LOW_MODE_CONSUMPTION > 0.0
 invariant       LOW_MODE_CONSUMPTION <= HIGH_MODE_CONSUMPTION
 invariant       TENSION > 0.0
 invariant       totalConsumption >= 0.0
 invariant       currentState != null
 invariant       !currentIntensity.isInitialised() || currentIntensity.getValue() >= 0.0

    Black-box Invariants

     invariant       URI != null && !URI.isEmpty()
 invariant       LOW_MODE_CONSUMPTION_RPNAME != null && !LOW_MODE_CONSUMPTION_RPNAME.isEmpty()
 invariant       HIGH_MODE_CONSUMPTION_RPNAME != null && !HIGH_MODE_CONSUMPTION_RPNAME.isEmpty()
 invariant       TENSION_RPNAME != null && !TENSION_RPNAME.isEmpty()

    Created on : 2023-09-29

    Author:
    Jacques Malenfant
    See Also:

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      protected boolean consumptionHasChanged
      true when the electricity consumption of the dryer has changed after executing an external event; the external event changes the value of currentState and then an internal transition will be triggered by putting through in this variable which will update the variable currentIntensity.
      protected fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.hioa.models.vars.Value<java.lang.Double> currentIntensity
      current intensity in amperes; intensity is power/tension.

      current state (OFF, LOW, HIGH) of the hair dryer.

      • HairDryerElectricityModel

        public HairDryerElectricityModel(java.lang.String uri,
                                 java.util.concurrent.TimeUnit simulatedTimeUnit,
                                 fr.sorbonne_u.devs_simulation.simulators.interfaces.AtomicSimulatorI simulationEngine)
                          throws java.lang.Exception
        create a hair dryer MIL model instance.

        Contract

         pre     uri == null || !uri.isEmpty()
 pre     simulatedTimeUnit != null
 pre     simulationEngine == null || !simulationEngine.isModelSet()
 pre     simulationEngine == null || simulationEngine instanceof AtomicEngine
 post    !isDebugModeOn()
 post    getURI() != null && !getURI().isEmpty()
 post    uri == null || getURI().equals(uri)
 post    getSimulatedTimeUnit().equals(simulatedTimeUnit)
 post    getSimulationEngine().equals(simulationEngine)
        Parameters:
        uri - URI of the model.
        simulatedTimeUnit - time unit used for the simulation time.
        simulationEngine - simulation engine to which the model is attached.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - to do.
